intro: Pentaschistis airoides subsp. jugorum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pentaschistis, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Europe and is often found in rocky or limestone soils. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
